meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a serf.
meanings.sent1: In the past, many people lived in serfage, working the land for their lord.
meanings.sent2: Serfage was a common way of life in medieval Europe.
meanings.sent3: The serfage in fairy tales always dreamt of freedom and adventure.
meanings.sent4: The weight of serfage felt like chains around their ankles.
meanings.sent5: The harsh reality of serfage meant limited opportunities for personal growth.

meanings.definition: The system or practice of serfdom.
meanings.sent1: Serfage restricted the rights and freedoms of many individuals.
meanings.sent2: The economy of the time relied heavily on serfage to function.
meanings.sent3: The serfage in the story comically tried to escape their duties but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The cycle of serfage perpetuated a sense of helplessness among the lower class.
meanings.sent5: The oppressive nature of serfage was a burden on society as a whole.

meanings.definition: The collective body of serfs on a particular estate.
meanings.sent1: The serfage on the estate worked together to cultivate the fields.
meanings.sent2: The lord oversaw the serfage and their daily tasks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous serfage played pranks on each other during their breaks.
meanings.sent4: The unity of the serfage community was their greatest strength.
meanings.sent5: The loyalty within the serfage ensured the estate ran smoothly.
